```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(collapse = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)
teach.salaries <- read.csv("C:/Users/squin/Downloads/DP_LIVE_06092018050003186.csv")
colnames(teach.salaries) <- c("Location", "Indicator", "Subject", "Measure", "Frequency", "Time", "Value", "Flag Codes")
x <- teach.salaries %>% group_by() %>% filter(Subject == "PRY_START", Location == "AUS" | Location == "USA") %>% select(Location, Time, Value)
```

A quick test of loading in new data and sending to blog.  First we clean the import, then we plot the function


```{r column, fig.cap='A column plot', tidy=FALSE}

ggplot(x, aes(Location,  Value)) + geom_col(aes(colour = factor(Location))) 
```
